enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Pre-Registration restricted to African Studies Adjunct Majors.
title: WCAS SWAHILI 121-3-20 Swahili II

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This is the third part of intermediate Swahili. The course builds on the foundation established in the Fall and Winter sessions. It is designed to expand students' communicative skills and a deeper cultural awareness about Swahili and East Africa. By the end of the course, learners are expected to demonstrate language competence ranging from Intermediate Low to Intermediate Mid levels. To enroll in the course, a student is required to have satisfactorily completed Swahili 122-2 or the equivalent.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
i) Sharifa Zawawi. 2001. Kiswahili Kwa Kitendo: An Introductory and Intermediate Course (2nd Edition). Africa World Press: New Jersey.
ii) Sharifa Zawawi. 1998. Jifunze Kiswahili Chetu: Workbook. Africa World Press: New
Jersey. Africa World Press: New Jersey.
iii) Swahili - English, English - Swahili Practical Dictionary (Hippocrene Practical Dictionary) by Nicholas Awde.

subject: SWAHILI
